title: Grade 12 - Technological Design in the Twenty-first Century TDJ4O (2009)
subject: Technological Education

document.title: Grade 12 - Technological Design in the Twenty-first Century TDJ4O (2009)

FE8A763304984F53BD0BBE46B86A1236.description: maintain an up-to-date portfolio that includes pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements in technological design (e.g., work logs, skills checklist, sketches, drawings, photographs of models and prototypes, virtual models), and explain why having a current portfolio is important for career development and advancement.

77877DDE9F064E658415900CC4B061EA.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the work habits that are important for success in the technological design industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., working safely, teamwork, reliability, organization, working independently, initiative, self-advocacy);

F6B0500D486C474DB5D99CBC5059F1E3.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the Essential Skills that are important for success in the technological design industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., reading text, writing, document use, computer use, oral communication, numeracy, thinking skills);

092E3770BB7B468FB1F3E78B536ED798.description: identify groups and programs that are available to support students who are interested in pursuing non-traditional career choices in the technological design industry (e.g., mentoring programs, virtual networking/support groups, specialized postsecondary programs, relevant trade/industry associations);

6715565CD7F34780A020CAFF55CD5907.description: identify and compare the educational and training requirements (e.g., degree, diploma, certificate, apprenticeship) for specific careers in technological design and related trades and services;

CBF28B42509D42BAA48F4EE14E36A0FE.description: describe a variety of career and business opportunities related to technological design (e.g., engineering, architecture, industrial design, control systems, apparel/textile design);

BA848C5B9E2142A3B3E9857660A1C570.description: Career Opportunities: investigate and describe a variety of careers related to technological design, and describe the training and education required for them.

B2DE3EED67CA4BC996DD53454CE55DDD.description: describe the rights and responsibilities of employees under the Occupational Health and Safety Act (e.g., right to know, right to refuse, right to participate).

C47A42FA20A44CCCBF8BE69612CCE672.description: use protective clothing, gear, and equipment appropriately (e.g., dust mask, safety glasses);

189CA7D4379B42D09540897F86EFCEAA.description: adhere to personal and environmental health and safety standards and procedures with respect to processes, materials, tools, equipment, and facilities throughout the design process and related activities (e.g., use protective equipment; set tool and equipment guards properly; ensure adequate ventilation and ergonomic seating and other workplace arrangements; follow safe operating procedures; keep work areas clean and organized; store materials and dispose of wastes properly);

FCC1D3FAEE3845739E728F2FE40BF46A.description: describe health and safety laws, regulations, standards, and agencies that relate to technological design (e.g., Ontario Building Code, Canadian Standards Association [CSA], Ministry of Labour);

B6856FBD7B8F448ABCC35C833C31D5B7.description: Health and Safety: describe and apply appropriate health, safety, and environmental practices and standards throughout the design process;

36DFFA3B58DF4D2ABD31D6F424CD0A07.description: describe intellectual property rights related to the design of products (e.g., copyright, trademark, patent).

71E5348274284A2ABE9E4002AC7E4766.description: describe how technological change affects society (e.g., health care developments increase lifespan, robotics replace human resources);

699AF1477FC249D4A8952724C59372EE.description: describe how society influences technology (e.g., higher energy costs spur development of more efficient vehicles, increasing population density leads to the construction of taller buildings, environmental awareness leads to development of alternative energy sources)

3DD8494764764A2F8461F25036669E92.description: research and report on the history of technological eras (e.g., agricultural, industrial, and information eras) and developments (e.g., invention of seed drill, mechanization of production, wireless communication);

2A482D44F6204F73BDFB72A7944E539A.description: Technology and Society: research and describe the relationship between society and technological development

4B56919B6956462AAF9EB93FF82B5A07.description: explain how good design can reduce the wastes produced by the manufacture and use of products.

873F51DDCEC4474E9F284E8AFC00F753.description: demonstrate an understanding of technological, political, and social strategies for managing the relationship between society and the environment (e.g., technological developments to improve energy efficiency and/or reduce emissions, lobbying governments for regulations and/or funding to improve the environment, education about environmental issues);

BEE1576F34CB4F35A34584A4B97309AE.description: describe, promote, and apply design practices that conserve energy and other resources (e.g., reuse or recycle lumber and other materials, use materials with recycled content, use wood glue instead of hot glue, use energy-management software for computers and other electronic equipment, use renewable energy, use high-efficiency motors and appliances);

49B22D511275435BA0C79E7E70C9BB19.description: demonstrate an understanding of environmental issues that affect product design (e.g., finite non-renewable resources, pollution, wastes, greenhouse gases, climate change, ozone depletion, life cycle of products);

DD85DBBD42F84BB98E548568B40D28E5.description: Technology and the Environment: demonstrate an understanding of environmentally responsible design practices and strategies, and apply them in the technological design process and related activities;

D4CB5BF6B8C8445998C700483B8839A2.description: report and reflect on their experiences throughout the design process, assessing individual skills development and the productivity and dynamics of the team, using appropriate written and/or oral formats

2377FD219E474033B0C113E757DBDBBD.description: create and present reports summarizing design choices and results of evaluations of projects, using a variety of appropriate formats (e.g., multimedia or oral presentation, technical report), with an emphasis on how the design was affected by societal influences;

F9DFBC744EC2423DB00FDDAF9876E63C.description: Reporting and Presenting: report on design choices, the societal influences that helped determine those choices, project evaluations, and reflections on their experiences throughout the design process, using appropriate formats and styles.

1E52EEBDB12D418485938746D369EA41.description: analyse products and/or processes in terms of established criteria and constraints (e.g., appearance, durability, ease of use, cost, budgetary constraints, societal concerns and preferences).

AE917E1691604EEE8985678910938193.description: use appropriate metric and imperial measuring tools, scales (e.g., metric: 1:10, 1 cm:1 m or 1:100, 1:500; imperial: 1 /2":1' or 1:24), and proportion techniques when creating a model or prototype;

26D7519086CA4B6BA0D9D5136AD67E39.description: use appropriate tools, equipment, and materials to create design models and prototypes (e.g., tools: rotary tool, bandsaw, fabric shears, computer-aided design [CAD] software; equipment: computer, sewing machine; materials: paper, wax, clay, wood, metals, composites, plastics, cardboard, starch, textiles);

C4671A69A86F4D7BBA9FFFFF5BBDD83E.description: Making and Testing Models and Prototypes: construct models and prototypes, using a variety of techniques, tools, and materials, and assess these models and prototypes in terms of the design criteria;

FF520BBDA8B74E65B667CAB42BF71FA8.description: produce technical drawings (e.g., orthographic projection, isometric projection) and/or presentation-quality drawings (e.g., perspective renderings, 3D computer imaging) of design solutions, using common drafting standards (e.g., line types, dimensioning, title block).

045DF7716D564C86941FFB030D10B19F.description: apply mathematical and scientific concepts and skills as required in the course of designing various products and/or processes;

D17334DFC8A944568397A3CB9F71D948.description: create and present freehand sketches to illustrate initial design concepts, applying a variety of elements and principles of graphic design;

E37FD92ACAA84A8F8D0F342BD674941A.description: Developing and Representing Design Ideas: develop designs and represent them graphically, using industry standards for illustrations and technical drawings;

530B6A558A8240B89CD82121D7E67254.description: research and identify relevant design criteria and constraints relating to societal influences (e.g., cultural considerations when designing restaurants, use of environmentally friendly materials, gender-specific designs).

245FA1A5B874411CB6686E97B11C09BC.description: use appropriate strategies and tools (e.g., sequence chart, time sheet, checklist, file management) to help plan, organize, and manage design projects;

77164A1DD6A94B3E8BC6AE06E06F7349.description: investigate and report on societal factors that influence technological design (e.g., news media, politics, religion, environment, gender, cultural and ethnic diversity);

4D72E769D6A54CA0A6A847966E5D17AB.description: gather and analyse relevant background information and design ideas from various sources (e.g., Canadian Standards Association [CSA] publications, Ontario Building Code, Machinery’s Handbook);

12C2F03A95BF492CAE88C79ADE59A912.description: Research, Planning, and Organization: use appropriate strategies and tools to research, plan, organize, and manage design projects;

EB7438E8FB434F2E845515124AC54230.description: describe the characteristics of various styles and formats for tracking and reporting the progress of a project (e.g., journals, portfolios, blogs).

1AFB43D471B94FAD8D4A921C4A367E4E.description: investigate and compare a variety of presentation methods (e.g., oral report, multimedia presentation, use of presentation software, use of overhead versus LCD projector, multimedia versus slides) based on relevant criteria (e.g., cost, ease of use, effectiveness for delivering intended message);

6F3F12E4E9B2434092E608E6A6F6F8C0.description: demonstrate an understanding of industrystandard terminology (e.g., scale versus ruler, artistic drawing versus technical drawing);

A2343612AA384FF28835EF319B5B7DAC.description: Reporting and Presenting: demonstrate an understanding of the terminology and communication methods and formats used in the design process

D619F860C0184AE9A6FBA5DC49CEC78D.description: identify and describe equipment (e.g., decibel meter, height gauge, compression tester) for assessing prototypes

612F5CF3ABB745A2A9099AA2BDECCA00.description: describe ways to assess models on the basis of various design criteria (e.g., societal needs, functionality, size, weight, durability, aesthetics, use of recyclable materials, cultural appropriateness);

6C22E76607054827BAA5D97CD4ED4A90.description: compare various kinds of models (e.g., conceptual, physical, virtual, theoretical) and prototypes (e.g., proof-of-principle, functional, form study), taking into account the tools, equipment, procedures, and materials required to produce them (e.g., tools: fabric shears, computer-aided design [CAD] software, computer numerical control [CNC] machine tools; equipment: computer, cut-out pattern; procedures: tracing, forming; materials: matt board, starch, linen, neoprene);

D3DD1C3D358449E0A1E847CDB3D95FB5.description: Making and Testing Models and Prototypes: demonstrate an understanding of various kinds of models and prototypes, and describe methods and equipment for making and assessing them;

9FE2313231F24F88B620B057C07ED90D.description: accurately interpret technical drawings and specifications.

52F0CFF8B6B644678BAD44C2A23968F6.description: demonstrate an understanding of drawing types (e.g., pictorial and rendered drawings, floor plans, elevations, sections, detail drawings) and of drafting methods (e.g., hand drawn, computeraided), standards (e.g., Canadian Standards Association [CSA]), and conventions (e.g., for dimensions, symbols, and abbreviations);

BCBA735C336C43E1B6A3CB136EF8097E.description: describe different methods for representing design ideas graphically (e.g., mind maps, sketches, design layouts, computer-aided drafting) with reference to principles and elements of graphic design (e.g., principles: contrast, proportion, movement, emphasis, pattern, balance; elements: line, colour, space, shape, size, value);

23004ADBA68148949103FEF552D0EE21.description: Representing Design Ideas Graphically: demonstrate an understanding of various methods for graphically representing design ideas and solutions;

24FA9A4C6A064B6B9B2E157CCDB528DC.description: describe strategies for the planning and management of human, material, and financial resources related to a design project (e.g., delegating tasks, selecting materials, estimating costs).

1C73385A7695400E97245E9C38A9D772.description: investigate and describe a variety of strategies, techniques, and tools for gathering pertinent information from appropriate sources (e.g., magazines covering social issues, Ministry of Culture website, interview with a cultural leader);

D480EC148A504D8798F2A5860094C10B.description: Research, Planning, and Organization: describe strategies, techniques, and tools for researching, planning, and managing projects to meet a specific societal or other need;

A0436CE4747F4905A698AFCD17318DE9.description: describe the relationship between various steps of the design process (e.g., testing a model or prototype, and then incorporating improvements or redesigning and retesting if necessary)

7827ABD148414DE4B520C7F604157D9F.description: describe the steps in the design process (e.g., define the problem or challenge, taking into account relevant contextual or background information; gather information about criteria, constraints, and available materials; generate possible solutions, using techniques such as brainstorming; choose the best solution; develop and produce a model or prototype; test the model or prototype; incorporate improvements or redesign and retest; report results)

E8203336A4B34C71B7824EF72B770EB9.description: describe ways in which societal needs, including environmental and economic factors, influence technological design (e.g., need for products that are smaller, lighter, faster, safer, and/or easier to use);

95A8024EEF1E4F78B910D071DB1F947A.description: describe the purpose of design for a given project (e.g., technological convergence, cost-efficient products, smaller living spaces) with reference to key technological concepts (e.g., aesthetics, control, environmental sustainability/stewardship, ergonomics, fabrication, function, innovation, material, mechanism, power and energy, structure, safety, systems)

5596D7D662964223AF19F997C8E599F2.description: Design Process: describe the design process and ways in which technological design is influenced by societal needs;
